Sentencas: Combustion synthesis (CS) in thermal explosion mode under conditions of controlled heat loss is used for synthesis of thin Ni-Al porous plates.
Titulo: Combustion synthesis and characterization of porous Ni-Al materials for metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells application

Sentencas: In the present work, compacted Ni-Al elemental powder mixtures placed between heat-removing clamp plates are heated in a furnace at 25 K/min up to 1000 K under the uniaxial load up to 1.2 MPa with further heat treatment at the temperature of 1100 K.
Titulo: Combustion synthesis and characterization of porous Ni-Al materials for metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells application

Sentencas: The effects of the Ni/Al mass ratio, reagent powders size, porosity and thickness of the reacting samples as well as conditions of heat-exchange during the CS on the reaction parameters have been studied.
Titulo: Combustion synthesis and characterization of porous Ni-Al materials for metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells application

Sentencas: Based on the thermocouple measurements, the temperature and timing characteristics of the CS process have been calculated.
Titulo: Combustion synthesis and characterization of porous Ni-Al materials for metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells application

Sentencas: The phase composition evolution during the process has been analyzed using X-ray diffraction and energy-dispersive X-ray spectroscopy.
Titulo: Combustion synthesis and characterization of porous Ni-Al materials for metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells application

Sentencas: Special attention has been paid to the study of the following characteristics of synthesized materials: porosity parameters, gas permeability and mechanical properties.
Titulo: Combustion synthesis and characterization of porous Ni-Al materials for metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells application

Sentencas: Due to the high strength of synthesized materials and formation of relatively homogenous structure with proper pores size and gas permeability, the synthesized porous Ni-Al plates can be considered as good supporting substrate for application in metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Combustion synthesis and characterization of porous Ni-Al materials for metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells application
